Docs4ai

Summary
Search, chat, and map your documents with AI, with the option to run entirely on-device using local embeddings and a local LLM. Docs4ai syncs folders (and Google Drive) into a sqlite-vec index, exposes your data via a built-in MCP server, and lets you query privately across macOS, Windows, and Linux.

Primary use cases
- Private document search with semantic and keyword matching
- Local-first knowledge discovery with a 2D semantic map
- Connect external AI clients to your docs via MCP
- Multi-profile setups for separate knowledge bases

Key features
- Local or OpenAI embeddings with sqlite-vec
- Google Drive and local folder sync
- Built-in MCP server (HTTP, MCP-compatible)
- Knowledge Map visualization for semantic neighborhoods
- In-app chat with document-grounded answers
- Cross-platform Electron app

MCP
- Built-in MCP server exposes your synced data over HTTP
- Default port: 3333 (configurable in-app)
- Endpoint: /mcp (POST)

Tech stack
- Electron + TypeScript
- better-sqlite3 + sqlite-vec
- Express (MCP server)

Getting started
- Install dependencies: npm install
- Rebuild native modules: npm run rebuild
- Run the app: npm start
